column5: just talked to my brothers wife surgery was done this morning and went well ekg this afternoon to check things out and then back into surgery tomorrow to check things out and make sure everything is working if everything ok he will be sent home  Great news and thanks again for all your thoughts and prayers it has been greatly appreciated  thanks rick
That's wonderful news, Rick. You'll surely have a much sounder sleep tonight too.
my boy has a list of people he asks God to bless every night... we will add your brother to the list Rick
Great news, happy for all of you.
Great news on no heart damage, that's gotta be a great relief to you and you're family.   Hope all goes well and he's home soon.
My prayers go out to him, rickster.  They got great medical care out in London; he's in fine hands.  Chin up,  reefrunner
Brothers are special people.  Wishing your bro speeding recovery.  All the best to the both of you.
Here's hoping for a speedy recovery.
here is a good prayer for you to use:  The Serenity Prayer God grant me the Serenity to accept the things I cannot change, Courage to change the things I can, and Wisdom to know the difference
Hang in there. Brothers need each other.

I know first hand what you and the rest of the family are going through at this point but as others have said, he is in the best care available and you have to be strong for him and have faith in the people that are caring for him ant the technology that is available today.  I'll be saying a prayer, keeping my fingers crossed and waiting for your update!
Best wishes and a quick recovery for your Brother's surgery. Thoughts and prayers being sent.
Our thought are being sent Rick
You got it Rick.  Very tense times, but it's times like this where the entire OFC family pulls together as one.  We're all with you.
Thoughts and prayers for your bro's recovery and for you and your family.

You heard from a few here who have had this done or have known of others who have had it done...hang onto that.  But a prayer or the crossing of fingers, toes whatever...doesn't hurt. Wishing your brother the very best and for you to have less stress.
yup fingers crossed.
my prayers are with you and your brother rickster, take care, Ryan

Rick, we're all sending good thoughts for your brother. Thank goodness they found out what was wrong with him & are taking steps to ensure he'll be all right in all the days to come. Hope he's back home and on his way to recovering soon! DebS
Be well.  I hope that bro is OK and we hear back from you soon.  We have london "people" that could meet you for a pint or a wing if some time off is what you need.
God bless ya's.
Keeping your brother in our thoughts!  Hope he's feeling better real soon!  It's pretty amazing what those surgeons can do now a days....I'm sure he'll be good as new.  Cliff and Carole(bly)
Good Luck Bud! facing the same issues with one of my brothers myself, tough deal.

test went well yesterday showing no damage to heart and no blockage surgery this afternoon or fri morning to put in defibulator and if all goes well they will fly him home early next week  I would really like to thank all for keeping him in their thoughts this is truly a great community  thanks again  rick
Encouraging news Rick, the first step to recovery sounds to be on its way.  Best wishes are still in mind.

Hey Rickster,  Some good news there, great to hear.  Have they come up with a diagnosis yet?  I've known a couple of people that have been diagnosis with Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia  Sounds similar to what your brother is going through.  Thoughts and prayers sent your way.
I hope you brothr is feeling better, he is in my prayers...   Anton
hope all goes well take care and pass it on to your brother
They do Great work in London.. he'll be fine!
Our thoughts are with you and your family and here's to a speedy recoverey.

i got called of the lake on Friday with news my brother had been taken to the hospital He has had some problems with his heart were it will take to racing and cannot get slowed down the doctor had to shock his heart four times to get him stabilized Things were looking better yesterday and they were discharging him when he had another episode Another four shocks to stabilize He flew by air ambulance to the univeristy hospital in london ont yesterday afternoon and as of this morning have had no news yet I just thought it might help if we could keep him in out thoughts today  Thanks in advance  Rick
Prayers coming your way. Take care
I am atheist so praying doesn't mean or do much to me, but i will keep my fingers crossed for your brothers speedy recovery.
Done deal Rickster, fingers crossed and positive thoughts all day. I take it your Bro' isn't very old ? That's a tough deal.  Keep your chin up,   Hookset.
All the best to your brother. You have lots of support from the OFC community.
our thoughts are with him
Consider it done Rick! Hoping for a speedy recovery and hope he gets better soon! These unknown issues can really be scary.
We'll be thinking good thoughts here for your brother, Rick.  Be well.
Think positive. He's in good hands now. London is the best of the best for heart issues. Our thoughts are with you. Take care.

I wish your brother the best.  Through my own personal heart issues, I am aware that there are a huge number of options available today that can keep him stable and in good health for many years to come.  I'm sure that he is in good hands.
Thoughts and prayers go out to you guys, keep strong.
I hope he will be okay.  My thoughts are with him today.  Keep us updated okay.  Joey
Best wishes for a speedy recovery.  My thoughts go out to you and your's.  HD

Thanks to all of you for your thoughts and well wishes. I just got off the phone with my brothers wife and it sounds like they want to operate on Thurs and put in a kind of pacemaker to regulate the heart. Want to get his strength up before they operate so thurs looks like the day if all goes well Sounds like he will be there for at least a week I will update when I know some more I am hoping my next update will be that the operation went well Fingers crossed   Thanks again to all for the well wishes and for Johnf for the offer This is truely a great community  Rick
Rick, know a couple of peolple who have had it done, no rpblem whatsoever, he will be good as new in no time.

My thoughts and prayers are with your brother.  My son had this rapid heart for a few years and had to have surgery which corrected the problem.  This is why this board is so special.  It is the fishing that bonds us together but we are concerned about each other.  Keep your faith.  Your brother will be OK.
thoughts go out for you and your brother

My thoughts and prayers are with your brother and his wife and family, including yourself.  Speaking from my own experiences, there are many options availalbe.  He is in good hnds at the London hospitals.  Please keep us posted  John

Rick, I have had both a pacemaker, and an internal defibrillator put into my body.  One (the pacemaker) keeps my heart from going below a certain number of beats per minute.  The other (the defibrillator) is designed to shock my heart back into a normal rhythm if I go into ventricular or atrial fibrillation (abnormally high and erratic heartbeat).  The surgery is a breeze.  It is usually day surgery.  The recovery is around 3 - 4 days.  Depending on what he is having done, he may not be able to drive for around a month, or raise his left arm above his shoulder for a month.  Other than that, he should be good, and should consider himself lucky to have not had any other problems at this point.  I hope the point of view from someone who has been through it helps.
Rickster, best wishes to your brother and our thoughts are for his speedy recovery.  Like others have said, my boss had this procedure done a couple of years ago and has recovered fully.
As many of the OFNCer's have mentioned above, the best wishes and thoughts to your brother on his speedy recovery!

My thoughts are with your brother Rick,and, scary as it may be, he is in the best of hands. I'm sure he will make a good recovery. I have friend who had it done years ago,and, it aint slowed him down any.  Best wishes.
Definably in our thoughts.  G
My thoughts are with your brother and your family Rickster.
All the best to your bro and you rickster.
